definition: history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: It will be an unprecedented occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 这将是史无前例的壮举。

sentences.english: He called it an unprecedented illegal act.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这是史无前例的非法行为。

sentences.english: Lin Dan, the giant of this era.
sentences.chinese: 羽坛史无前例，后无来者的时代巨人。

sentences.english: The affairs, and fates, of nations are intertwined as never before.
sentences.chinese: 各国的事务和命运史无前例地纠缠在一起。

sentences.english: The housing bubble was unique, and uniquely awful.
sentences.chinese: 房地产泡沫是史无前例的，而且又是独特地可怕。

sentences.english: It is becoming urbanised on a scale unprecedented in history.
sentences.chinese: 它正在进行的城市化，其规模史无前例。
一个史无前例的富裕时代。

sentences.english: Yang said the cold spell had been "unprecedentedly long".
sentences.chinese: 杨说这次的冷空气持续时间“史无前例的长”。

sentences.english: And anti-Semitism in Europe culminated in an unprecedented holocaust.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的反犹太主义最终发展成一场史无前例的浩劫。

sentences.english: Moreover, Republicans will have unprecedented control over redistricting.
sentences.chinese: 还有，共和党在重划选区上将有史无前例的控制权。

sentences.english: Something unprecedented happened in China in late October.
sentences.chinese: 二零零八年十月，中国发生了一件史无前例的事情。

sentences.english: The scale of this crash, said officials, was unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 官员称，这次撞击的规模，是史无前例的。

sentences.english: It is unprecedented for prosecutors to discredit their own star witness.
sentences.chinese: 检察官怀疑自己的主要证人，这是史无前例的。

sentences.english: Our comradeship and our brotherhood in war were unexampled .
sentences.chinese: 我们在战争年代同舟共济的兄弟情谊是史无前例的。

sentences.english: The government is making unprecedented efforts to stanch the bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府正在采取史无前例的行动来理顺经济。

sentences.english: The crime was unprecedented in its cunning and murderous results.
sentences.chinese: 这是是蓄意谋杀的犯罪，是史无前例的。

definition: unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
unprecedented/for the first time/never before/first ever
to surpass all others of its kind before and since/to have neither predecessors nor successors
pinyin: qian2 wu2 gu3 ren2 hou4 wu2 lai2 zhe3
